name: Pakorae
author: Natasha
summary: This is a really tasty snack we usually have in our country, with tea, on a rainy day. Besan is ground chick peas; it's also known as gram flour, and you can find it at Indian stores. Serve with ketchup or chili sauce for dipping.
ingredients: ½ teaspoon salt, or to taste
directions: In a medium bowl, mix together the besan, water, salt, chili powder, turmeric, cumin, coriander seeds, onion, and jalapeno pepper until it forms a smooth mixture with no flour lumps
Heat the oil in a deep skillet over medium-high heat
When the oil is sizzling hot, drop dough by tablespoonfuls, and fry until golden brown on each side
Drain on paper towels, and serve hot with ketchup or chili sauce for dipping
